decks.notes: This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a strong board presence and dealing damage to the opponent efficiently. The deck includes powerful creatures like Kumano Faces Kakkazan and Cori-Steel Cutter, as well as burn spells like Burst Lightning and Soul-Scar Mage. The deck aims to apply pressure early on and maintain aggression throughout the game, utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Emberheart Challenger to close out matches quickly. The deck's mana base is optimized for consistent aggression and the inclusion of utility lands helps provide additional value in the late game.

This deck revolves around utilizing the interaction between Greasefang, Okiba Boss and Parhelion II to create a powerful combo that can quickly overwhelm opponents. The deck includes cards like Fleeting Spirit and Seasoned Hallowblade to support the combo pieces, along with removal spells such as Fatal Push and Vanishing Verse to control the board. The addition of Thoughtseize helps disrupt opponent's strategies while Monument to Endurance provides additional protection. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors for the combo.

This deck focuses on utilizing Lotus Field to generate a large amount of mana quickly in order to cast powerful spells like Scapeshift and Lumra, Bellow of the Woods. The deck also includes cards like Crumbling Vestige, Arboreal Grazer, and Stock Up to help ramp up mana production. The inclusion of cards like Thassa's Oracle and Mistrise Village suggests a potential win condition involving either deck manipulation or combat damage. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful spells.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on early disruption with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress, followed by aggressive creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Graveyard Trespasser. Removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat help clear the way for your creatures to deal damage quickly. Mutavault and Blightstep Pathway provide additional versatility in mana sources, while cards like Fear of Missing Out and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker offer additional value and card advantage. Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Kolaghan's Command provide powerful late-game options to secure victory.

The main concept of this Pioneer 1 vs 1 deck revolves around utilizing green devotion to quickly ramp up mana and overwhelm opponents with aggressive creature plays. By focusing on green creatures and enchantments that contribute to devotion, the deck aims to generate large amounts of mana with cards like Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx and Oath of Nissa. This mana is then used to cast powerful creatures like Cavalier of Thorns and Old-Growth Troll, backed up by support from Kiora, Behemoth Beckoner and Storm the Festival to maintain board presence and pressure opponents.

This deck aims to control the game early on with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, while also applying pressure with evasive creatures such as Faerie Miscreant and Mockingbird. The key idea is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with hand disruption and removal, while developing a board presence that can quickly close out the game. By combining aggression with disruption, this Dimir Aggro deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver opponents in the Pioneer 1 vs 1 format. The inclusion of different disruptive creatures like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Cecil, Dark Knight add another layer of complexity to the deck's strategy.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage to deal damage efficiently. The deck also includes powerful pump spells like Monstrous Rage and Reckless Rage to push through for lethal damage. The land base is optimized for fast mana production and consistency, allowing for explosive starts and relentless pressure on the opponent. Overall, the deck aims to win the game quickly by utilizing the synergy between creatures and burn spells to maintain a constant offensive presence.

This Jund aggro deck focuses on creating a combo with Witch's Oven, Cauldron Familiar, and Mayhem Devil to deal damage to the opponent while gaining value. It utilizes scavengers talent to disrupt the opponent's game plan and has a strong removal package with Fatal Push and Deadly Dispute. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Bloodtithe Harvester, Ygra, Eater of All, and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker. The mana base is optimized to support the deck's aggressive strategy while also having some utility lands like Den of the Bugbear and Sokenzan, Crucible of Defiance.

This deck focuses on aggressively ramping up green mana and devotion to maximize the power of its creatures and spells. By quickly developing its board presence and mana base, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with large threats like Vorinclex, Craterhoof Behemoth, and Titan of Industry. The inclusion of cards like Oath of Nissa and Invasion of Ixalan help ensure consistent mana production and creature deployment. Overall, the strategy revolves around building a strong battlefield presence and using it to quickly close out games.

The concept of this UW Control deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, card draw, and powerful planeswalkers. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building up its own resources and closing out the game with powerful finishers like Elspeth, Storm Slayer and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. The inclusion of Kaheera as a companion provides additional synergy and flexibility to the deck. Overall, the key strategy revolves around maintaining control of the battlefield and outvaluing the opponent through efficient use of resources.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and spells in the Rakdos color combination to quickly pressure the opponent and finish the game before they can stabilize. It includes a mix of removal spells, disruption, and resilient threats to ensure a fast and powerful game plan. The deck's mana base is carefully constructed to support its aggressive strategy and enable consistency in its plays. The key strategy is to apply pressure early and efficiently while disrupting the opponent's game plan to secure victory.

The deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent using a combination of aggressive creatures and burn spells. It aims to control the board early with efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, while also utilizing spells like Reckless Rage and Burst Lightning to remove blockers or deal direct damage. The inclusion of Kumano Faces Kakkazan and Opera Love Song provides additional reach and finishing power to close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. The mana base is optimized for consistent and fast mana production to support the aggressive game plan.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. It aims to apply pressure early on with efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, while also using burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage to clear the path for damage. The deck includes powerful legendary creatures like Kumano, Master Yamabushi and Cori, Steel Cutter to provide additional threats. The mana base is built to ensure consistent access to both red and green mana sources for casting spells.

The main concept of this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by using removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat, as well as hand disruption with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress. The deck also aims to control the board by utilizing cards like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Graveyard Trespasser. The inclusion of Castle Locthwain provides card advantage, while Mutavault can serve as both a creature and a land. The deck aims to grind out opponents through attrition and resource management.

This Boros Aggro deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly with a combination of efficient creatures, including Novice Inspector and Venerated Loxodon, backed up by removal spells like Portable Hole and Gleeful Demolition. The deck also utilizes artifacts like Ornithopter and Cosmogrand Zenith to provide additional threats and card advantage. By maintaining a fast and aggressive game plan, this deck seeks to apply pressure early and close out games before opponents can stabilize.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The key strategy is to maintain board presence while using removal spells like Reckless Rage and Burst Lightning to clear the way for attacks. Cards like Monstrous Rage and Kumano Faces Kakkazan can provide additional damage and reach, while creatures like Soul-Scar Mage and Monastery Swiftspear can pump up the pressure early in the game. The deck also benefits from lands like Ramunap Ruins and Den of the Bugbear for additional reach and damage potential.
